item.name: CVPowerShellSDK
Get-CVBlackoutWindow
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-CVBlackoutWindow [-CommcellId <Int32>] [-ClientId <Int32>] [-AppTypeId <Int32>] [-InstanceId <Int32>] [-BackupsetId <Int32>][-SubclientId <Int32>] [-ClientgroupId <Int32>] [-CompanyId <Int32>] [-SchedulePolicyId <Int32>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVBlackoutWindow [-Name <String>] [-CommcellId <Int32>] [-ClientId <Int32>] [-AppTypeId <Int32>] [-InstanceId <Int32>] [-BackupsetId <Int32>] [-SubclientId <Int32>] [-ClientgroupId <Int32>] [-CompanyId <Int32>] [-SchedulePolicyId <Int32>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVBlackoutWindow [-Id <Int32>] [-CommcellId <Int32>] [-ClientId <Int32>] [-AppTypeId <Int32>] [-InstanceId <Int32>] [-BackupsetId <Int32>] [-SubclientId <Int32>] [-ClientgroupId <Int32>] [-CompanyId <Int32>] [-SchedulePolicyId <Int32>] [<CommonParameters>]

DESCRIPTION

    Method to retrieve blackout window rules from the CommServe.
    Output can be filtered by rule Id, Name, CommcellId, ClientId, AppTypeId, InstanceId, BackupsetId, SubclientId, ClientgroupId, CompanyId, or SchedulePolicyId.

PARAMETERS

    -Name <String>
        Specify blackout window rules to be output by Name.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Id <Int32>
        Specify blackout window rule to be output by Id.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -CommcellId <Int32>
        Specify blackout window rule subset by CommcellId (default = 2).

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                2
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientId <Int32>
        Specify blackout window rule subset by ClientId.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -AppTypeId <Int32>
        Specify blackout window rule subset by AppTypeId.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -InstanceId <Int32>
        Specify blackout window rule subset by InstanceId.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -BackupsetId <Int32>
        Specify blackout window rule subset by BackupsetId.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SubclientId <Int32>
        Specify blackout window rule subset by SubclientId.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientgroupId <Int32>
        Specify blackout window rule subset by ClientgroupId.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -CompanyId <Int32>
        Specify blackout window rule subset by CompanyId.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SchedulePolicyId <Int32>
        Specify blackout window rule subset by SchedulePolicyId.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing blackout window rules.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVBlackoutWindow
    
EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Get-CVBlackoutWindow -Name CommCell-BWR-1
   
EXAMPLE 3
 
    PS C:\>Get-CVBlackoutWindow -Id 3

EXAMPLE 4

    PS C:\>Get-CVBlackoutWindow -ClientgroupId 4

EXAMPLE 5

    PS C:\>Get-CVBlackoutWindow -ClientId 2

EXAMPLE 6

    PS C:\>Get-CVBlackoutWindow -AppTypeId 81

EXAMPLE 7

    PS C:\>Get-CVBlackoutWindow -InstanceId 9

item.name: Set-CVBlackoutWindow
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Set-CVBlackoutWindow [-Properties] <Object> [-Force] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]
    
    
DESCRIPTION

    Method to set/update a blackout window rule.

PARAMETERS

    -Properties <Object>
        Piped-in Properties set.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    1
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Force [<SwitchParameter>]
        Switch to Force override of default 'WhatIf' confirmation behavior.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS
    
    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing job submission result.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>$props = Get-CVBlackoutWindow -Name 'My Blackout Rule'

    PS C:\>$props.name = 'Your Blackout Rule'
    PS C:\>$props | Set-CVBlackoutWindow -Force

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>$props = Get-CVBlackoutWindow -Id 7

    PS C:\>$props.operations = @(8, 512, 524888)
    PS C:\>$props | Set-CVBlackoutWindow -Force

item.name: Enable-CVBlackoutWindowIgnoreHigherLevelRules
item.description:

    -AppTypeId <Int32>

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -BackupsetId <Int32>

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SubclientId <Int32>

        Required?                    false

    -Force [<SwitchParameter>]

        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing result code.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Enable-CVBlackoutWindowIgnoreHigherLevelRules -SubclientId 4

item.name: Get-CVClient
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-CVClient [-AdditionalSettings] [-Version] [-TimeZone] [-AllProperties] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVClient [-Name <String>] [-AdditionalSettings] [-Version] [-TimeZone] [-AllProperties] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVClient [-Id <Int32>] [-AdditionalSettings] [-Version] [-TimeZone] [-AllProperties] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    If the Name parameter is not provided, this method will output a list of clients from the CommServe.
    If the Name parameter is provided, a default subset of client properties will be output for the specified client.


PARAMETERS

    -Name <String>
        Get detail properties for client specified by Name.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Id <Int32>
        Get detail properties for client specified by Id.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -AdditionalSettings [<SwitchParameter>]
        Retrieves additional setting properties for each client in the list.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Version [<SwitchParameter>]
        Retrieves package version properties for the specified client.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -TimeZone [<SwitchParameter>]
        Retrieves timezone properties for the specified client.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -AllProperties [<SwitchParameter>]
        Retrieves all properties for the specified client.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing list of CommServe clients or client properties.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient -Name ProdTest1

EXAMPLE 3

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient -Name ProdTest1 -AllProperties

EXAMPLE 4

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient -Id 2

EXAMPLE5

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient -Id 2 -AllProperties

EXAMPLE 6

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient -Name ProdTest1 -AllProperties | Select-Object -ExpandProperty client

EXAMPLE 7

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient -Name ProdTest1 -AllProperties | Select-Object -ExpandProperty client | Select-Object jobResulsDir

EXAMPLE 8

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient -Name ProdTest1 -Version -TimeZone

EXAMPLE 9

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient -AdditionalSettings

EXAMPLE 10

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient -Name SNOWSQL1 -AdditionalSettings

EXAMPLE 11

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient -Name ProdTest1 | Get-CVSubclient

EXAMPLE 12

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient | Get-CVSubclient

item.name: Get-CVClientGroup
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-CVClientGroup [-AllProperties] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVClientGroup [-Name <String>] [-AllProperties] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Method to retrieve client groups or a single specified group from the CommServe.


PARAMETERS

    -Name <String>
        Get a client group by Name.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -AllProperties [<SwitchParameter>]
        Get detail properties for each client group.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing client group properties.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVClientGroup

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Get-CVClientGroup -Name Snow-Test

EXAMPLE 3

    PS C:\>Get-CVClientGroup -Name Snow-Test -AllProperties

EXAMPLE 4

    PS C:\>Get-CVClientGroup -Name Snow-Test -AllProperties | Select-Object -ExpandProperty firewallConfiguration

EXAMPLE 5

    PS C:\>Get-CVClientGroup -Name Snow-Test -AllProperties | Select-Object -ExpandProperty firewallConfiguration | Select-Object
    -ExpandProperty firewallOptions

item.name: Get-CVVersionInfo
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-CVVersionInfo [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Method to retrieve the current version, service pack level, and time zone settings on the CommServe.


PARAMETERS

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing CommServe configuration data.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVVersionInfo

item.name: Get-CVAlert
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-CVAlert [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Method to retrieve the list of alerts from the CommServe.
    This method is implemented with Powershell paging support.


PARAMETERS

    -IncludeTotalCount [<SwitchParameter>]
        Include total count of result record set.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Skip <UInt64>
        Get alerts with paging support -First 20 -Skip 5 (20 per page, skip first 5 pages).

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -First <UInt64>
        Get alerts with paging support -First 20 (20 per page).

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing CommServe alert data.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVAlert

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Get-CVAlert -IncludeTotalCount -First 5 -Skip 0 (5 per page, skip none)

item.name: Get-CVSubclient
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-CVSubclient [-Name <String>] [-Id <Int32>] -ClientName <String> [-AllProperties] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVSubclient [-Name <String>] [-Id <Int32>] -ClientObject <Object> [-AllProperties] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Method to retrieve the list of subclients or a named subclient for a given client from the CommServe.


PARAMETERS

    -Name <String>
        Get properties for the subclient specified by Name.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Id <Int32>

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientName <String>
        Get list of subclient properties for ClientName.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientObject <Object>

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -AllProperties [<SwitchParameter>]
        Retrieves all properties for subclients.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug, ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable, OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] all subclients of the specified client, or the specified single subclient.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVSubclient

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Get-CVSubclient -ClientName clientName

EXAMPLE 3

    PS C:\>Get-CVSubclient -ClientName clientName -Name subclientName

EXAMPLE 4

    PS C:\>Get-CVSubclient -ClientName clientName -Name subclientName -AllProperties

EXAMPLE 5

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient -Name clientName | Get-CVSubclient -AllProperties | Select-Object -ExpandProperty subClientProperties | Select-Object -ExpandProperty fsSubClientProp

item.name: Get-CVId
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-CVId [-ClientName] <String> [[-AgentName] <String>] [[-BackupSetName] <String>] [[-InstanceName] <String>] [[-SubclientName]
    <String>] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Method to retrieve the Id for a given Entity from the CommServe.


PARAMETERS

    -ClientName <String>
        Get Client Id for ClientName.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    1
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -AgentName <String>
        Get Application Id for AgentName. Example 'File System', 'Active Directory Agent'

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    2
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -BackupSetName <String>
        Get BackupSet Id for BackupSetName.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    3
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -InstanceName <String>
        Get Instance Id for InstanceName.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    4
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SubclientName <String>
        Get Subclient Id for SubclientName.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    5
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] Id of the specified client

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVId -ClientName 'YashClient'

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Get-CVId -ClientName 'YashClient' -AgentName 'File System'

EXAMPLE 3

    PS C:\>Get-CVId -ClientName 'YashClient' -AgentName 'File System'  -BackupSetName 'defaultBackupSet'

EXAMPLE 4

    PS C:\>Get-CVId -ClientName 'YashClient' -AgentName 'File System'  -InstanceName 'DefaultInstanceName'

EXAMPLE 5

    PS C:\>Get-CVId -ClientName 'YashClient' -AgentName 'File System'  -BackupSetName 'defaultBackupSet' -SubclientName 'default'

item.name: Set-CVClient
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Set-CVClient -Name <String> -Properties <Object> [-Force] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

    Set-CVClient -Id <Int32> -Properties <Object> [-Force] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Method to set client properties.


PARAMETERS

    -Name <String>
        Set properties on client specified by Name.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Id <Int32>
        Set properties on client specified by Id.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Properties <Object>
        Piped-in Properties set.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Force [<SwitchParameter>]
        Switch to Force override of default 'WhatIf' confirmation behavior.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing job submission result.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>$clientProps = Get-CVClient -Name 'carbonwincs1' -AllProperties

    PS C:\>$clientProps.client.displayName='carbonwincs1-1'
    PS C:\>$clientProps.client.clientDescription = 'carbonwincs1-1 description modified with REST API Post request'
    PS C:\>$clientProps.client | Set-CVClient -Name 'carbonwincs1' -Force

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>$clientId = (Get-CVVirtualMachine -Name INSIELVM-92-pl).client.clientId

    PS C:\>$clientProps = Get-CVClient -Id $clientId -AllProperties
    PS C:\>$clientProps.client.displayName='INSIELVM-92-pl'
    PS C:\>$clientProps.client.clientDescription = 'INSIELVM-92-pl description modified with REST API Post request'
    PS C:\>$clientProps.client | Set-CVClient -Id $clientId

item.name: Get-CVJob
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-CVJob [-ClientName <String>] [-SubclientName <String>] [-JobFilter <String>] [-JobCategory <String>] [-CompletedTime <Int32>]
    [-Details] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVJob [-Id <Int32>] [-Details] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Get the list of all jobs. Based on parameters this commandlet filters the output.
    This method is implemented with Powershell paging support.


PARAMETERS

    -Id <Int32>

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientName <String>
        Filter output based on ClientName.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SubclientName <String>
        Filter output based on SubclientName: requires ClientName parameter.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -JobFilter <String>
        Filter output based on JobFilter. Example Snapbackup, DATA_VERIFICATION or SYNTHFULL etc.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -JobCategory <String>
        Filter output based on JobCategory. Example Active, Finished, All.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -CompletedTime <Int32>
        Filter output based on completed job lookup time expressed in hours.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                24
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Details [<SwitchParameter>]
        Retrieves the details for a job.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -IncludeTotalCount [<SwitchParameter>]
        Include total count of result record set.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Skip <UInt64>
        Get list of jobs with paging support -First 20 -Skip 5 (20 per page, skip first 5 jobs).

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -First <UInt64>
        Get list of jobs with paging support -First 20 (20 per page).

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing job details.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob -CompletedTime 8 -IncludeTotalCount

EXAMPLE 3

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob -CompletedTime 72 -IncludeTotalCount -First 5

EXAMPLE 4

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob -CompletedTime 240 -IncludeTotalCount -First 10 -Skip 0

EXAMPLE 5

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob -CompletedTime 240 -IncludeTotalCount -First 10 -Skip 20

EXAMPLE 6

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob -Details

EXAMPLE 7

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob -ClientName VC2KR2

EXAMPLE 8

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob -ClientName VC2KR2 -SubclientName snap_backup2 -CompletedTime 72

EXAMPLE 9 

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob | Where-Object { $_.Status -like 'Running' }

EXAMPLE 10

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob | Where-Object { $_.Status -like 'Pending' }

EXAMPLE 11

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob | Where-Object { $_.Status -like 'Waiting' }

EXAMPLE 12

    PS C:\>Get-CVJob | Where-Object { $_.Status -like 'Completed' }

item.name: Connect-CVServer
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Connect-CVServer -Server <String> [-Port <String>] [-User <String>] [-Password <SecureString>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Connect-CVServer -Server <String> [-Port <String>] [-Credential <PSCredential>] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Method to get CommServe authorization token.


PARAMETERS

    -Server <String>
        The CommServe to connect to.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Port <String>
        Optional port specification if non-default has been configured (default: 81)

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                $REST_DEFAULT_PORT
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -User <String>
        User name for login.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Password <SecureString>
        Secure password for login.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Credential <PSCredential>
        Powershell credential object. Used as alternative to -User <user> -Password <password>

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                [PSCredential]::Empty
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs <String> indicating success or failure of login attempt.

EXAMPLE 1

    Connect-CVServer -Server <CVWebserver name>-User <admin>

EXAMPLE 2

    Connect-CVServer -Server <CVWebserver name>-User <admin> -Password (ConvertTo-SecureString 'password' -AsPlainText -Force)

EXAMPLE 3

    Connect-CVServer -Server <CVWebserver name>-User <admin> -Password (ConvertTo-SecureString 'password' -AsPlainText -Force) -Port [port]

EXAMPLE 4

    PS C:\>$Credential= New-Object -TypeName System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -ArgumentList 'admin',('plainTextPassword' |
    ConvertTo-SecureString -AsPlainText -Force)

    Connect-CVServer -Credential $Credential -Server <CVWebserver name>

item.name: Get-CVSQLDatabase
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-CVSQLDatabase [-SortColumn {bkpTime | bkpSize | insName | dbName | cName | planName}] [-SortDescending] [-OnlySLA] [-ShowSysDB] [-AllProperties] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVSQLDatabase [-Name <String>] [-ClientName <String>] [-InstanceName <String>] [-SortColumn {bkpTime | bkpSize | insName | dbName | cName | planName}] [-SortDescending] [-OnlySLA] [-ShowSysDB] [-AllProperties]
    [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVSQLDatabase [-Id <Int32>] [-InstanceId <Int32>] [-SortColumn {bkpTime | bkpSize | insName | dbName | cName | planName}] [-SortDescending] [-OnlySLA] [-ShowSysDB] [-AllProperties] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First
    <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVSQLDatabase [-InstanceObject <Object>] [-SortColumn {bkpTime | bkpSize | insName | dbName | cName | planName}] [-SortDescending] [-OnlySLA] [-ShowSysDB] [-AllProperties] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>]
    [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    This method is implemented with Powershell paging support.
    If the Name parameter is not provided, this method will output all protected SQL databases.
    If the Name parameter is provided, SQL databases matching the name will be output.


PARAMETERS

    -Name <String>
        Get SQL database specified by Name.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Id <Int32>
        Get SQL database specified by database Id.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientName <String>
        Get SQL databases associated with ClientName.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -InstanceName <String>
        Get SQL databases associated with InstanceName.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -InstanceId <Int32>
        Get SQL databases associated with InstanceId.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -InstanceObject <Object>
        Get SQL databases associated with piped InstanceObject.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SortColumn
        Sort SQL databases by: bkpTime, bkpSize, insName, dbName, cName, planName.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                dbName
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SortDescending [<SwitchParameter>]
        Sort SQL databases by specified column in descending order; Default is ascending order.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -OnlySLA [<SwitchParameter>]
        Get only SQL databases with missed SLAs.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ShowSysDB [<SwitchParameter>]
        Get SQL databases including system databases.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -AllProperties [<SwitchParameter>]
        Get SQL databases with all properties.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -IncludeTotalCount [<SwitchParameter>]
        Include total count of result record set.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Skip <UInt64>
        Get SQL instances with paging support -First 20 -Skip 5 (20 per page, skip first 5 pages).

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -First <UInt64>
        Get SQL instances with paging support -First 20 (20 per page).

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing SQL database properties.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLDatabase

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLInstance | Get-CVSQLDatabase

EXAMPLE 3

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient | Get-CVSQLInstance | Get-CVSQLDatabase

EXAMPLE 4

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLDatabase -IncludeTotalCount -First 20 -Skip 5 (20 per page, skip first 5 pages)

EXAMPLE 5

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLDatabase -OnlySLA

EXAMPLE 6

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLDatabase -Name space-end

EXAMPLE 7

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLDatabase -Name space_end

EXAMPLE 8

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLDatabase -SortColumn bkpSize

EXAMPLE 9

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLDatabase -SortColumn bkpSize -SortDescending

EXAMPLE 10

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLDatabase -AllProperties

item.name: Get-CVSQLInstance
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-CVSQLInstance [-SortColumn {insId | insName | version | cName | noDBs | planName}] [-SortDescending] [-OnlySLA] [-AllProperties] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVSQLInstance [-Name <String>] [-ClientName <String>] [-SortColumn {insId | insName | version | cName | noDBs | planName}] [-SortDescending] [-OnlySLA] [-AllProperties] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>]
    [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVSQLInstance [-ClientObject <Object>] [-SortColumn {insId | insName | version | cName | noDBs | planName}] [-SortDescending] [-OnlySLA] [-AllProperties] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>]
    [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    This method is implemented with Powershell paging support.
    If the Name parameter is not provided, this method will output all protected SQL instances.
    If the Name parameter is provided, SQL instances matching the name will be output.


PARAMETERS
 
    -Name <String>
        Get SQL instance specified by Name.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientName <String>
        Get SQL instances associated with ClientName.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientObject <Object>
        Get SQL instances associated with piped ClientObject.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SortColumn
        Sort SQL instances by: insId, insName, version, cName, noDBs, or planName.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                insId
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SortDescending [<SwitchParameter>]
        Sort SQL instances by specified column in descending order; default is ascending order.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -OnlySLA [<SwitchParameter>]
        Get only SQL instances with missed SLAs.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -AllProperties [<SwitchParameter>]
        Get SQL instances with all properties.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -IncludeTotalCount [<SwitchParameter>]
        Include total count of result record set.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Skip <UInt64>
        Get SQL instances with paging support -First 20 -Skip 5 (20 per page, skip first 5 pages).

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -First <UInt64>
        Get SQL instances with paging support -First 20 (20 per page).

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing SQL instance properties.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLInstance

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient | Get-CVSQLInstance

EXAMPLE 3

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLInstance -IncludeTotalCount -First 20 -Skip 5 (20 per page, skip first 5 pages)

EXAMPLE 4

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLInstance -OnlySLA

EXAMPLE 5

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLInstance -Name SNOWSQL1\SQL2008R2

EXAMPLE 6

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLInstance -SortColumn noDBs

EXAMPLE 7

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLInstance -SortColumn insId -SortDescending

EXAMPLE 8

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLInstance -AllProperties

EXAMPLE 9

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLInstance -AllProperties | Select-Object -ExpandProperty auth

EXAMPLE 10

    PS C:\>Get-CVSQLInstance -AllProperties | Select-Object -ExpandProperty auth | Select-Object -ExpandProperty credential

        Required?                    true

item.name: Get-CVVirtualMachine
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Get-CVVirtualMachine [-Name <String>] [-Protected] [-UnProtected] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVVirtualMachine [-Name <String>] [-Id <String>] [-Protected] [-UnProtected] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVVirtualMachine [-Name <String>] [-ClientName <String>] [-Protected] [-UnProtected] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVVirtualMachine [-Name <String>] [-ClientId <Int32>] [-Protected] [-UnProtected] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]

    Get-CVVirtualMachine [-Name <String>] [-ClientObject <Object>] [-Protected] [-UnProtected] [-IncludeTotalCount] [-Skip <UInt64>] [-First <UInt64>] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    This method is implemented with Powershell paging support.
    Method to retrieve the list of virtual machines in the CommCell.
    Output can be filtered by Protected/Unprotected status, active subclients of a client, and virtual machine Name.


PARAMETERS

    -Name <String>
        Filter output to virtual machine Name.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Id <String>
        Specify Id representing virtual machine GUID.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientName <String>
        Filter output by active subclients of ClientName.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientId <Int32>
        Filter output by active subclients of ClientId.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientObject <Object>
        Filter output by active subclients of ClientObject.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Protected [<SwitchParameter>]
        Filter output by Protected virtual machines.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -UnProtected [<SwitchParameter>]
        Filter output by UnProtected virtual machines.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -IncludeTotalCount [<SwitchParameter>]
        Include total count of result record set.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Skip <UInt64>
        Get list of virtual machines with paging support -First 20 -Skip 5 (20 per page, skip first 5 pages).

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -First <UInt64>
        Get list of virtual machines with paging support -First 20 (20 per page).

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] representing a virtual machine.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVVirtualMachine

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Get-CVVirtualMachine -Id 502df85e-7fe7-e1d6-8f0a-a9cdadd8c13e

EXAMPLE 3

    PS C:\>Get-CVVirtualMachine -IncludeTotalCount -First 20 -Skip 5 (20 per page, skip first 5 pages)

EXAMPLE 4

    PS C:\>Get-CVVirtualMachine -Protected

EXAMPLE 5

    PS C:\>Get-CVVirtualMachine -UnProtected

EXAMPLE 6

    PS C:\>Get-CVClient | Get-CVVirtualMachine -Protected

EXAMPLE 7

    PS C:\>Get-CVVirtualMachine -Name autocs-winvm2

EXAMPLE 8

    PS C:\>Get-CVVirtualMachine -ClientName Openstack-V2-client -Protected

EXAMPLE 9

    PS C:\>Get-CVVirtualMachine -ClientName Openstack-V2-client -Name autocs-winvm2

item.name: Add-CVVirtualMachine
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Add-CVVirtualMachine -ClientName <String> [-SubclientName <String>] -Entity <String> [-EntityType {SERVER | RES_POOL | VAPP | DATACENTER | FOLDER | CLUSTER | DATASTORE | DATASTORE_CLUSTER | VM | VMName | VMGuestOS | VMGuestHostName
    | ClusterSharedVolumes | LocalDisk | ClusterDisk | UnprotectedVMs | ROOT | FileServer | SMBShare | TypesFolder | VMFolder | ServerFolder | TemplateFolder | StorageRepositoryFolder | VAppFolder | DatacenterFolder | ClusterFolder |
    VMPowerState | VMNotes | VMCustomAttribute | Network | User | VMTemplate | Tag | TagCategory | Subclient | ClientGroup | ProtectionDomain | ConsistencyGroup | InstanceSize | Organization}] [-OperationType {ADD | DELETE |
    OVERWRITE}] [-Force] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

    Add-CVVirtualMachine -ClientObject <Object> [-SubclientName <String>] -Entity <String> [-EntityType {SERVER | RES_POOL | VAPP | DATACENTER | FOLDER | CLUSTER | DATASTORE | DATASTORE_CLUSTER | VM | VMName | VMGuestOS |
    VMGuestHostName | ClusterSharedVolumes | LocalDisk | ClusterDisk | UnprotectedVMs | ROOT | FileServer | SMBShare | TypesFolder | VMFolder | ServerFolder | TemplateFolder | StorageRepositoryFolder | VAppFolder | DatacenterFolder |
    ClusterFolder | VMPowerState | VMNotes | VMCustomAttribute | Network | User | VMTemplate | Tag | TagCategory | Subclient | ClientGroup | ProtectionDomain | ConsistencyGroup | InstanceSize | Organization}] [-OperationType {ADD |
    DELETE | OVERWRITE}] [-Force] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Method to add virtual server subclient content.


PARAMETERS

    -ClientName <String>
        ClientName of the client in which subclient resides.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientObject <Object>
        Piped ClientObject of the client in which subclient resides.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SubclientName <String>
        SubclientName to which content should be added. If this parameter not passed, assumes default subclient.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Entity <String>
        Name of the Entity to be added. Multiple entities can be added using a comma separated list. Virtual machine Name, datastore name etc.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -EntityType
        EntityType can be VMName (default), Host or Cluster etc.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                VMName
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -OperationType

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                ADD
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Force [<SwitchParameter>]
        Switch to Force override of default 'WhatIf' confirmation behavior.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing job submission result.
    If successful, specified content is added to the subclient.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Add-CVVirtualMachine -Entity LSRegVm1 -ClientName vsa-vc65.testlab.commvault.com

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Add-CVVirtualMachine -Entity LSRegVm1 -ClientName vsa-vc65.testlab.commvault.com -SubclientName LSRegVMG1

item.name: Add-CVVirtualMachineGroupContent
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Add-CVVirtualMachineGroupContent -SubclientObject <Object> -EntityType {Host | Datastore | VMName | VMNamePattern | GuestOS | GuestDNSHostname | PoweredState | Notes | TemplateState | Tag | TagCategory} [-PoweredState {Off | On |
    Other}] [-TemplateState <Boolean>] [-MatchingPattern {Contains | Equals | StartsWith | EndsWith}] [-DisplayName <String>] [-VMName <String>] [-CreateClientsForDiscoveredVms] [-Force] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Method to perform a virtual machine group content preview with option to create clients from result set.


PARAMETERS

    -SubclientObject <Object>
        Virtual machine group for content preview. Can be piped or passed as a parameter.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -EntityType
        Virtual server EntityType including: Host, Datastore, VMName, VMNamePattern, GuestOS, GuestDNSHostname, PoweredState, Notes, TemplateState, Tag, and TagCategory.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -PoweredState
        Paired with EntityType PoweredState: On, Off, Other.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                On
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -TemplateState <Boolean>
        Paired with EntityType TemplateState: $True or $False.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                True
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -MatchingPattern
        Matching pattern to be used for search on DisplayName can be: Contains, Equals, StartsWith, or EndsWith.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                Equals
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -DisplayName <String>
        Search Term.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -VMName <String>
        Paired with EntityType VMName, this is the VM GUID.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -CreateClientsForDiscoveredVms [<SwitchParameter>]
        Switch to create clients for discovered virtual machines.
        Recommend running first without this switch to preview discovery results.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Force [<SwitchParameter>]
        Switch to Force override of default 'WhatIf' confirmation behavior.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing virtual machine discovery result.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Get-CVSubclient -Name GRS-VMGroup1 -ClientName accounting.mycompany.com | Add-CVVirtualMachineGroupContent -EntityType Datastore -MatchingPattern EndsWith -DisplayName DS1

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Get-CVSubclient -Name GRS-VMGroup1 -ClientName finance.mycompany.com | Add-CVVirtualMachineGroupContent -EntityType Host -MatchingPattern Equals -DisplayName 123.44.66.77

EXAMPLE 3

    PS C:\>Get-CVSubclient -Name GRS-VMGroup1 -ClientName sales.mycompany.com | Add-CVVirtualMachineGroupContent -EntityType VMNamePattern -MatchingPattern Contains -DisplayName GaryTest -CreateClientsForDiscoveredVms

EXAMPLE 4

    PS C:\>Get-CVSubclient -Name GRS-VMGroup1 -ClientName repos.mycompany.com | Add-CVVirtualMachineGroupContent -EntityType VMName -VMName 500bc16c-fb3f-17d6-5712-c00b4524d3d2

item.name: Restore-CVVirtualMachine
item.description:
SYNTAX

    [-OutofPlace] [-PowerOnAfterRestore] [-OverwriteExisting] [-Force] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

    [-PowerOnAfterRestore] [-OverwriteExisting] [-Force] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Method to initiate restore/recovery of specified virtual machine.


PARAMETERS

    -Id <String>
        Specify the virtual machine to be restored by GUID.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Specify the virtual machine to be restored by Name.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

        Source virtual machine associated ClientName

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientObject <Object>

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SubclientName <String>
        Specify SubclientName to override the default behaviour.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -JobId <Int32>
        Specify JobId from which to restore.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                0
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -CopyPrecedence <Int32>

        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -DestHypervisorType

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                vmware
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -OutofPlace [<SwitchParameter>]

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -PowerOnAfterRestore [<SwitchParameter>]

        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -OverwriteExisting [<SwitchParameter>]

    -Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Restore-CVVirtualMachine -Id 502df85e-7fe7-e1d6-8f0a-a9cdadd8c13e

EXAMPLE 3

item.name: Remove-CVVirtualMachine
item.description:
SYNTAX

    Remove-CVVirtualMachine -ClientName <String> [-SubclientName <String>] -Entity <String> [-EntityType {SERVER | RES_POOL | VAPP | DATACENTER | FOLDER | CLUSTER | DATASTORE | DATASTORE_CLUSTER | VM | VMName | VMGuestOS |
    VMGuestHostName | ClusterSharedVolumes | LocalDisk | ClusterDisk | UnprotectedVMs | ROOT | FileServer | SMBShare | TypesFolder | VMFolder | ServerFolder | TemplateFolder | StorageRepositoryFolder | VAppFolder | DatacenterFolder |
    ClusterFolder | VMPowerState | VMNotes | VMCustomAttribute | Network | User | VMTemplate | Tag | TagCategory | Subclient | ClientGroup | ProtectionDomain | ConsistencyGroup | InstanceSize | Organization}] [-Force] [-WhatIf]
    [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

    Remove-CVVirtualMachine -ClientObject <Object> [-SubclientName <String>] -Entity <String> [-EntityType {SERVER | RES_POOL | VAPP | DATACENTER | FOLDER | CLUSTER | DATASTORE | DATASTORE_CLUSTER | VM | VMName | VMGuestOS |
    VMGuestHostName | ClusterSharedVolumes | LocalDisk | ClusterDisk | UnprotectedVMs | ROOT | FileServer | SMBShare | TypesFolder | VMFolder | ServerFolder | TemplateFolder | StorageRepositoryFolder | VAppFolder | DatacenterFolder |
    ClusterFolder | VMPowerState | VMNotes | VMCustomAttribute | Network | User | VMTemplate | Tag | TagCategory | Subclient | ClientGroup | ProtectionDomain | ConsistencyGroup | InstanceSize | Organization}] [-Force] [-WhatIf]
    [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]


DESCRIPTION

    Method to remove virtual server subclient content.


PARAMETERS

    -ClientName <String>
        ClientName of the client in which subclient resides.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -ClientObject <Object>
        Piped ClientObject of the client in which subclient resides.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue, ByPropertyName)
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -SubclientName <String>
        SubclientName from which content should be removed. If this parameter not passed, assumes default subclient.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Entity <String>
        Name of the Entity to be removed. Multiple entities can be added using a comma separated list. Virtual machine Name, datastore name etc.

        Required?                    true
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -EntityType
        EntityType can be VMName (default), Host or Cluster etc.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                VMName
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Force [<SwitchParameter>]
        Switch to Force override of default 'WhatIf' confirmation behavior.

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value                False
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -WhatIf [<SwitchParameter>]

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    -Confirm [<SwitchParameter>]

        Required?                    false
        Position?                    named
        Default value
        Accept pipeline input?       false
        Accept wildcard characters?  false

    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216).

INPUTS

OUTPUTS

    Outputs [PSCustomObject] containing job submission result.
    If successful, specified content is removed from the subclient.

EXAMPLE 1

    PS C:\>Remove-CVVirtualMachine -Entity LSRegVm1 -ClientName vsa-vc65.testlab.commvault.com

EXAMPLE 2

    PS C:\>Remove-CVVirtualMachine -Entity LSRegVm1 -ClientName vsa-vc65.testlab.commvault.com -SubclientName LSRegVMG1

CVPowershellSDK is a Windows PowerShell package for Commvault software.

CVPowershellSDK uses the Commvault REST API to perform operations on a CommCell via the WebConsole.

[_Visit GitHub_](https://github.com/Commvault/CVPowershellSDK)

Commvault PowerShell Module Reference
-------------------------------------
This section contains reference information for the cmdlets in the Commvault PowerShell Module.

request.description:
Description

This operation creates a new discussion on a file in a shared folder or on a shared file.

Supported Error Codes

Description

Commvault REST APIs support token-based authentication via the Authtoken request header. The POST Login API is used to retrieve the authentication token. Once obtained, the authentication token must be inserted into the Authtoken header for all requests. Note: The authentication token expires after 30 minutes of inactivity. request.description:
Description

This operation creates a new folder in Edge Drive based on the GUID of the parent folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the folder name has some unacceptable characters.
404 Not Found The specified parent folder does not exist.
409 Conflict A folder with the specified name already exists in the same location.

The response body will include the information of the folder that already exists. For example:

<App_FileResourceResponse> <error errorCode="409" /> <fileResource parentGuid="97409005317b4dbd9c138d2fd80a9e50" GUID="be7d714583584307bf00f1de47212b94" directory="1" name="NewFolder" path="\Folder1\NewFolder" /> </App_FileResourceResponse>

request.description:
Description

This operation uploads a single file to Edge Drive. The API is used for uploading files that are relatively small in size.

For larger files (greater than 4 MB), upload the files in multiple data chunks. For more information, see Initiate an Upload Session

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. Example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.
  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=fullFile&forceRestart=true
413 Request Entity Too Large Upload attempted for a large file (greater than 4MB). For large files, upload the files in multiple data chunks. For more information, see Initiate an Upload Session.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_full_upload.htm)

response.name: POST Upload a File

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to initiate the upload session for uploading multiple file chunks to Edge Drive. Optionally, you can also send the first file chunk along with the request.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.

Make sure the parameter values and format in the header request are correct. For example, the header request for file modified time must be specified in UNIX timestamp format (in seconds). Specifying a millisecond value will return an error. Also, the name must be base64 encoded.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. For example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182"

  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&forceRestart=true
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_upload_header_request.htm)

response.name: POST Upload a File in Chunks (1)

request.description:
Description

This operation returns the preview of a file in Edge Drive based on the file ID.

Preview is currently supported for all images and Microsoft Office file types.

By default, you can preview files that have a maximum file size limit of 10 MB. For instructions on changing the file size limit, see Changing the File Size Limit for Preview.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the file name has some unacceptable characters.
204 No Content Preview is not available for the file.
403 Forbidden User does not have permissions to preview or the preview is requested for a folder or an unsupported file type.
404 Not Found The specified file does not exist.
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/get_drive_preview_by_fileid.htm)

exec: tests["Response Body contains folder name"] = responseBody.has("name");

request.description:
Description

This operation creates a new folder in Edge Drive based on the GUID of the parent folder.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters or the folder name has some unacceptable characters.
404 Not Found The specified parent folder does not exist.
409 Conflict A folder with the specified name already exists in the same location.

The response body will include the information of the folder that already exists. For example:

<App_FileResourceResponse> <error errorCode="409" /> <fileResource parentGuid="97409005317b4dbd9c138d2fd80a9e50" GUID="be7d714583584307bf00f1de47212b94" directory="1" name="NewFolder" path="\Folder1\NewFolder" /> </App_FileResourceResponse>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_folder_by_folderid.htm)

response.name: POST Create Folder by ID

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to share a specific file or folder in Edge Drive based on the file or folder path.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required parameters.
404 Not Found The specified file or folder does not exist.
409 Conflict The file or folder is already shared or the specified share name already exists.

The response body will have the shareID of the existing share if the file or folder is already shared. The shareID can be used to update the users/user groups to which the file or folder is already shared. For example:

<App_SharedFoldersResp> <shareInfo> <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="Test" syncWebFolderId="10" /> </shareInfo> <resp errorMessage="" errorCode="409" /> </App_SharedFoldersResp>
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_share_by_path.htm)

response.name: POST Share Folder by Path

body.raw:
<App_ShareInfo sharedToOperationType="2" status="0">
    <browseInfo>
    	<paths path="\DemoShareFolder"></paths>
        <emailInfo dontSendEmail="1" emailMessage=""/> 
    </browseInfo>
    <shareFolder syncWebFolderName="DemoShareFolder"/>
    <sharedTo permission="1" userType="1"> 
        <user userName="admin"/> 
    </sharedTo>  
</App_ShareInfo>

request.description:
Description

This operation uploads a single file to a shared folder in Edge Drive. The API is used for uploading files that are relatively small in size.

For larger files (greater than 4 MB), upload the files in multiple data chunks. For more information, see Initiate an Upload Session.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.

Make sure the parameter values and format in the header request are correct. For example, the header request for file modified time must be specified in UNIX timestamp format (in seconds). Specifying a millisecond value will return an error. Also, the name must be base64 encoded.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. For example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182"

  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&forceRestart=true
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_share_full_upload.htm)

response.name: POST Upload File to Share

item.name: Upload a File in Chunks to Share (1)

request.description:
Description

Use this operation to initiate the upload session for uploading multiple file chunks to the shared folder in Edge Drive. Optionally, you can also send the first file chunk along with the request.

Supported Error Codes

Code Status Description
400 Bad Request The request is missing required headers or file content in the request body.

Make sure the parameter values and format in the header request are correct. For example, the header request for file modified time must be specified in UNIX timestamp format (in seconds). Specifying a millisecond value will return an error. Also, the name must be base64 encoded.
403 Forbidden The user does not have rights to upload the file or the upload operation is disabled by the administrator by disabling backup activity from the CommCell Console.
409 Conflict An upload operation is already in progress for the same file. The response body will have the existing requestId and the number of bytes that the web server has already received for the file. For example:

<DM2ContentIndexing_UploadFileResp requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182" chunkOffset="780830" errorCode="409" />

When a conflict occurs,

  • Use the same requestID to resume a chunk file upload from the byte offset sent from the server by sending data chunks.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&requestId="13213022088234198160108125214183230586134182"

  • Use the following URL parameter to force restart the upload of the file from the beginning. If this approach is used a new upload request session will be initiated and response will have the requestID.  Using the new requestID, the file data can be sent from beginning.

    /drive/file/action/upload?uploadType=chunkedFile&forceRestart=true
[_More Details_](http://documentation.commvault.com/commvault/v11/article?p=features/rest_api/operations/post_drive_share_upload_header_request.htm)

response.name: POST Upload a File in Chunks to Share (1)
